name: Classical Music Player App UI Kit
description:
First, The Intro

Pretty much all music player apps are designed with popular music in mind. That means that they can only display tags such as Album, Artist & Song Title.

Unpopular (classical) music on the other hand needs a lot more tags to show all the necessary information (metadata): Composer, Work, Movement, Performer, Conductor...

Some apps & websites do show all the tags properly (like Qobuz and Deutsche Grammophon) but the majority still don't. (Apple Music has its special Grouping tag that is a poor replacement for Work and is rarely used.)


Why Does This Exist?

The lack of "interest" in supporting these tags (developers don't listen to classical music - which is fine, but at least acknowledge that a portion of your app's userbase does) inspired me to create this example for an album tracklist's design.


Now you have a basis for the UI and don't have to try to figure out how and where to position certain data.

The components are designed to be very customizable (some examples are presented on the ðŸ“±Mockups page).
